Job Posting:172568 - Position: W26 Winter 2026 Co-op: Associate Developer (4 Months) 172568 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 09/10/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 09/03/2025 02:18 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country CGI Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2026 - Winter W26 Winter 2026 Co-op: Associate Developer (4 Months) 172568 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Job Description Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Category: Software Development/ Engineering Main location: Canada, Ontario, Toronto Position ID: J0825-1726 Employment Type: Student Internship Position Description: Role Overview: We are seeking a hard-working Co-op Developer to join our growing and dynamic team in Banking & Financial Services. This is a great opportunity to work under the mentorship of our Project and Program Manager to assist and support the development team in all design-related tasks. At CGI, our strength is built on our ability to work together. Our diverse set of backgrounds offer different perspectives and new ways of thinking. It encourages lively discussions, inspires thought leadership, and helps us build better solutions for our people and clients. We are seeking someone who thrives in this setting and is inspired to craft meaningful solutions through true collaboration. Start Date: January 2026 Application Deadline: September 26th 2025 Perks of Being a CGI Co-op: • Have access to a 1:1 Mentor matched with you based on your interests. • Participate in monthly socials to meet co-ops across the country. • Access professional development workshops hosted by domain experts on topics ranging from how to be a top consultant, how to apply the agile methodology, data & analytics and more! To learn more about CGI and hear from our Co-ops and New Grads, visit www.cgi.com/startmycareer Your Day-to-Day: • Develop API services and web applications as per the client specifications using coding standards and standard methodologies. • Perform unit testing and defect fixes. • Participate in project planning meetings along with all relevant agile ceremonies. • Co-ordinate with business analysts and testing teams for delivery. Your future duties and responsibilities: What We're Looking for: • Takes accountability for results and exhibits a "can do" demeanor. • Has an appetite to continuously evolve and improve, address difficult problems and seek/give constant feedback. • Demonstrates flexibility and is able to move forward without having all of the answers. • Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment. What you can expect from us: Together, as owners, let's turn meaningful insights into action. Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you'll reach your full potential because… You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That's why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company's strategy and direction. Your work creates value. You'll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise. You'll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You'll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons. At CGI, we value the strength that diversity brings and are committed to fostering a workplace where everyone belongs. We collaborate with our clients to build more inclusive communities and empower all CGI partners to thrive. As an equal-opportunity employer, being able to perform your best during the recruitment process is important to us. If you require an accommodation, please inform your recruiter. To learn more about accessibility at CGI, contact us via email. Please note that this email is strictly for accessibility requests and cannot be used for application status inquiries. Come join our team-one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world. Job Requirements Required qualifications to be successful in this role: Your Qualifications: • Experience with Java (Spring, Spring Boot, and REST APIs) and familiarity with all stages of the SDLC lifecycle. • Solid understanding of Java, Java Web, GIT, and Junit. • Basic knowledge of relational databases and SQL. • Analytical conduct and good problem-solving skills. • Superb communication and interpersonal skills. #LI-RD12 Skills: • Detail-oriented • Development (Loc) Development Life-Cycle • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://cgi.njoyn.com/corp/xweb/xweb.asp?NTKN=c&clid=21001&Page=JobDetails&Jobid=J0825-1726&BRID=1232844&lang=1 Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
